result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhonda H Ray

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Rhonda H Ray in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Rhonda H Ray.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for discovery but has received an offer.
Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

If cash bail was previously posted, it is to be refunded to the poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Dominique W./Woodmans listed in the Criminal Complaint.

9:02 AM Defendant Rhonda H Ray in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Rhonda H Ray. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Attorney Menden is asking for this matter to be set before the Trial Court.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
